unnormalised: ## Ditch the Cassette, Embrace the Stream: Music's Gone Digital, Yaar!
normalised: ## Ditch the Cassette, Embrace the Stream: Music's Gone Digital, Yaar!

unnormalised: Remember the days of meticulously curating cassette tapes? Or saving up your pocket money to buy that one Anu Malik soundtrack from Rhythms in Connaught Place? Man, those were the days. But let's be real, lugging around a Walkman in the Delhi heat wasn't exactly glamorous.
normalised: Remember the days of meticulously curating cassette tapes? Or saving up your pocket money to buy that one Anu Malik soundtrack from Rhythms in Connaught Place? Man, those were the days. But let's be real, lugging around a Walkman in the Delhi heat wasn't exactly glamorous.

unnormalised: Thank God for music streaming! Now, with a simple tap on your phone, you have access to literally millions of songs. From the latest Bollywood bangers (did you hear that new Pritam track in "Brahmastra"?) to independent artists crafting magic in their garage, the options are endless.
normalised: Thank God for music streaming! Now, with a simple tap on your phone, you have access to literally millions of songs. From the latest Bollywood bangers (did you hear that new Pritam track in "Brahmastra"?) to independent artists crafting magic in their garage, the options are endless.

unnormalised: Gone are the days of scrambling to find that one CD you wanted. Streaming has revolutionized how we discover new music, too. Personalized playlists curated by algorithms that somehow *know* you're in the mood for a Kishore Kumar classic on a rainy day? It's almost scary how good they are!
normalised: Gone are the days of scrambling to find that one C D you wanted. Streaming has revolutionized how we discover new music, too. Personalized playlists curated by algorithms that somehow *know* you're in the mood for a Kishore Kumar classic on a rainy day? It's almost scary how good they are!

unnormalised: Of course, there are the purists who argue about sound quality (Vinyl still reigns supreme, they say!). But for the average listener, the convenience is unbeatable. Think about it: you're stuck in Bangalore traffic, 5 pm peak hour, and you need a little something to keep you sane. Queue up your favorite AR Rahman playlist and *voila* - instant tranquility.
normalised: Of course, there are the purists who argue about sound quality (Vinyl still reigns supreme, they say!). But for the average listener, the convenience is unbeatable. Think about it: you're stuck in Bangalore traffic, five P M peak hour, and you need a little something to keep you sane. Queue up your favorite A R Rahman playlist and *voila* - instant tranquility.

unnormalised: Plus, the subscription models are pretty reasonable these days. You can get a premium plan for around Rs. 99 a month, which is cheaper than buying even two new Bollywood film songs individually back in the day!
normalised: Plus, the subscription models are pretty reasonable these days. You can get a premium plan for around rupee ninety nine a month, which is cheaper than buying even two new Bollywood film songs individually back in the day!

unnormalised: Even institutions like IIT Delhi are probably blasting music from Spotify in their hostels late at night. I mean, who wouldn't want some background tunes while pulling an all-nighter studying for that thermodynamics exam?
normalised: Even institutions like I I T Delhi are probably blasting music from Spotify in their hostels late at night. I mean, who wouldn't want some background tunes while pulling an all-nighter studying for that thermodynamics exam?

unnormalised: So, ditch the dust bunnies on your old cassette player and embrace the world of streaming. Your ears (and your back) will thank you. Now, excuse me while I go find that new Badshah song I heard about... It's waiting for me on my phone. Happy listening!
normalised: So, ditch the dust bunnies on your old cassette player and embrace the world of streaming. Your ears (and your back) will thank you. Now, excuse me while I go find that new Badshah song I heard about... It's waiting for me on my phone. Happy listening!
